messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] 2+2=4 ( was Re:  2239 - Ned back to Tia re HSLDA
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oops, that should say ...2+3 are eternally NOT equal to 4? Bob,  and others :-),  have you read any of C.S. Lewis? . Lewis uses  logic, similar to the
messages.messageBody:
> Is > 2+2 equal to 4, if the consequences of 2+3 are eternally NOT eternally 4?
Oops, that should say "...2+3 are eternally NOT equal to 4?">


Bob, and others :-), have you read any of C.S. Lewis? . Lewis uses logic, similar to the above, to explain Christianity - not necessarily religion - in his book "Mere Christianity". Lewis was C of E and definitely not Fundamentalist. His book is a compilation of his understandings as a Christian, using logic and clear simple terms..Leonie


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
